intro: Dorstenia contrajerva subsp. tenuiloba, commonly known as the slender leafed mountain mallow, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
